name: Deficits in intellectual functioning
description: Impairments in reasoning, problem-solving, planning, abstract thinking, judgment, academic learning, and learning from experience.

name: Deficits in adaptive functioning
description: Limitations in meeting developmental and sociocultural standards for independence and responsibility.

name: Delays in developmental milestones
description: Significant delays in achieving typical milestones such as walking and talking.

name: Difficulty with problem-solving and abstract thinking
description: Challenges in understanding and solving problems, as well as difficulties grasping abstract concepts.

name: Poor academic performance compared to peers
description: Struggles to achieve educational success at a level comparable to individuals of the same age.

name: Difficulty with daily living activities
description: Challenges with performing essential daily tasks such as dressing and feeding.

name: Delayed or impaired speech development
description: Significant delays or abnormalities in the development of speech.

name: Misarticulations
description: Incorrect production of sounds in words, such as substituting or omitting sounds.

name: Difficulty maintaining a conversation
description: Challenges in initiating, sustaining, or appropriately responding during conversations.

name: Limited vocabulary
description: Restricted range of words used, or inability to follow conversational norms.

name: Persistent difficulties in speech sound production
description: Speech production challenges that interfere with intelligibility or communication.

name: Fluency disturbances
description: Interruptions in the flow of speech, such as stuttering or repetitive blocks.

name: Deficits in social-emotional reciprocity
description: Difficulty understanding and responding to social cues or interactions.

name: Deficits in nonverbal communicative behaviors
description: Limited or atypical use of gestures, facial expressions, or eye contact.

name: Deficits in developing and understanding relationships
description: Difficulty forming and maintaining appropriate social connections.

name: Repetitive motor movements or speech patterns
description: Repetitive behaviors such as hand-flapping, echolalia, or rigid routines.

name: Hyper- or hypo-reactivity to sensory input
description: Extreme sensitivity or lack of sensitivity to sensory stimuli like sound or touch.

name: Inattention
description: Difficulty focusing on tasks or maintaining attention, often leading to incomplete tasks.

name: Hyperactivity and impulsivity
description: Excessive movement, inability to remain seated, talking excessively, or acting without thinking.

name: Difficulty with academic skills
description: Struggles with reading, writing, spelling, or mathematics, even after intervention.

name: Clumsiness or poor coordination
description: Difficulty with fine or gross motor skills, such as handwriting or catching a ball.

name: Repetitive, purposeless motor behaviors
description: Stereotypic movements like hand-flapping or rocking that interfere with functioning.

name: Motor tics
description: Involuntary, repetitive movements such as eye blinking or facial grimacing.

name: Vocal tics
description: Involuntary, repetitive vocalizations such as throat clearing or repetitive phrases.

name: Hallucinations
description: Perceptual experiences without external stimuli, such as hearing voices or seeing visions. Auditory hallucinations are the most common.

name: Delusions
description: Fixed, false beliefs that are not changed despite conflicting evidence. Examples include persecutory, grandiose, somatic, and erotomanic delusions.

name: Disorganized Thinking
description: Inferred from speech patterns such as loose associations (shifting between unrelated topics), tangentiality (answers diverge from the topic), or word salad (incoherent mixing of words).

name: Grossly Disorganized or Abnormal Motor Behavior
description: Includes unpredictable agitation or restlessness, inappropriate emotional responses, difficulty initiating or completing tasks, and catatonic behaviors such as immobility, mutism, or bizarre postures.

name: Negative Symptoms
description: Includes affective flattening (reduced emotional expression), avolition (decreased motivation for purposeful activities), anhedonia (loss of interest or pleasure in activities), alogia (reduced speech output), and social withdrawal (decreased engagement with others).

name: Schizophrenia Symptoms
description: Two or more core symptoms (delusions, hallucinations, disorganized thinking) present for a significant portion of time within a month, with impaired functioning in work, interpersonal relations, or self-care.

name: Schizophreniform Disorder Symptoms
description: Similar to schizophrenia symptoms but lasting 1 to 6 months, with functioning that may not be impaired.

name: Brief Psychotic Disorder Symptoms
description: Sudden onset of one or more psychotic symptoms such as delusions, hallucinations, disorganized thinking, or catatonic behavior, lasting at least 1 day but less than 1 month.

name: Schizoaffective Disorder Symptoms
description: Major mood episode (depressive or manic) concurrent with schizophrenia symptoms, with delusions or hallucinations present for 2 or more weeks without a mood episode.

name: Delusional Disorder Symptoms
description: Presence of one or more delusions lasting at least 1 month, with no marked impairment in functioning or bizarre behavior.

name: Catatonia Symptoms
description: Includes stupor (no psychomotor activity or response to environment), mutism (minimal or no verbal response), negativism (opposition or lack of response to instructions), posturing (rigid pose), echolalia (mimicking another's speech), and echopraxia (mimicking another's movements).

name: Other Specified/Unspecified Psychotic Disorders Symptoms
description: Symptoms characteristic of schizophrenia spectrum disorders that cause significant distress or impairment but do not meet full criteria for any specific disorder.

name: Manic Episode Symptoms
description: Abnormally elevated, expansive, or irritable mood lasting at least 1 week (or any duration if hospitalization is necessary), with three or more (four if mood is only irritable) of the following: increased energy or activity, inflated self-esteem or grandiosity, decreased need for sleep, pressured speech, flight of ideas, distractibility, and risky behaviors.

name: Hypomanic Episode Symptoms
description: Same symptoms as a manic episode but lasting at least 4 consecutive days, not causing marked impairment in functioning or necessitating hospitalization, and without psychotic features.

name: Depressive Episode Symptoms
description: Five or more symptoms during a 2-week period (at least one must be depressed mood or loss of interest/pleasure): depressed mood, anhedonia, weight changes, sleep disturbances, psychomotor agitation or retardation, fatigue, feelings of worthlessness or guilt, difficulty concentrating, and suicidal ideation.

name: Mixed Features
description: Manic/hypomanic and depressive symptoms occur simultaneously, such as symptoms of depression during a manic/hypomanic episode or vice versa, with observable rapid mood shifts or behaviors indicative of both states.

name: Bipolar I Disorder Symptoms
description: At least one manic episode is required. Depressive episodes are common but not required for diagnosis.

name: Bipolar II Disorder Symptoms
description: At least one hypomanic episode and one major depressive episode are required. There is no history of a manic episode.

name: Cyclothymic Disorder Symptoms
description: For at least 2 years (1 year in children/adolescents): periods of hypomanic symptoms that do not meet criteria for a hypomanic episode and periods of depressive symptoms that do not meet criteria for a major depressive episode.

name: Substance/Medication-Induced Bipolar and Related Disorder Symptoms
description: Mood disturbances (manic, hypomanic, or depressive symptoms) directly related to substance use or withdrawal.

name: Bipolar and Related Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition Symptoms
description: Mood disturbances (manic, hypomanic, or depressive symptoms) caused by a medical condition such as hyperthyroidism or brain injury.

name: Other Specified/Unspecified Bipolar and Related Disorders Symptoms
description: Significant symptoms of bipolarity that do not fully meet criteria for a specific disorder.

name: Depressed mood
description: Feeling sad, empty, or hopeless most of the day, nearly every day (may appear as irritability in children or adolescents).

name: Anhedonia
description: Markedly diminished interest or pleasure in almost all activities most of the day.

name: Significant weight or appetite changes
description: Weight loss or gain, or changes in appetite (e.g., eating too little or too much).

name: Sleep disturbances
description: Insomnia or hypersomnia nearly every day.

name: Psychomotor agitation or retardation
description: Observable restlessness or slowing down of physical and emotional reactions.

name: Fatigue or loss of energy
description: Feeling drained nearly every day.

name: Feelings of worthlessness or excessive guilt
description: Disproportionate self-blame or feelings of failure.

name: Difficulty concentrating or indecisiveness
description: Trouble focusing on tasks, making decisions, or following through.

name: Suicidal ideation
description: Recurrent thoughts of death, suicidal thoughts, plans, or attempts.

name: Severe temper outbursts
description: Verbal or behavioral outbursts grossly disproportionate in intensity or duration to the situation.

name: Chronic irritability
description: Persistently irritable or angry mood most of the day, nearly every day.

name: Poor appetite or overeating
description: Noticeable changes in eating patterns leading to weight loss or gain.

name: Low energy or fatigue
description: Persistent tiredness or lack of physical or mental energy.

name: Low self-esteem
description: Feelings of inadequacy or worthlessness.

name: Feelings of hopelessness
description: Pervasive sense of despair and lack of optimism about the future.

name: Marked affective lability
description: Mood swings or increased sensitivity to rejection, especially premenstrually.

name: Marked irritability or anger
description: Significant frustration or outbursts, particularly related to hormonal changes.

name: Physical symptoms of PMDD
description: Symptoms such as breast tenderness, bloating, or joint/muscle pain.

name: Mood reactivity
description: Mood brightens in response to positive events.

name: Leaden paralysis
description: Heavy feelings in limbs making movement effortful.

name: Psychotic features
description: Delusions or hallucinations related to depressive states.

name: Catatonic features
description: Mutism, stupor, or bizarre postures observed during depressive episodes.

name: Excessive worry
description: Persistent and uncontrollable worry about various aspects of life (e.g., work, relationships).

name: Restlessness or feeling keyed up
description: A sense of being 'on edge.'

name: Easily fatigued
description: Persistent tiredness even without physical exertion.

name: Difficulty concentrating
description: Mind going blank or trouble focusing due to worry.

name: Irritability
description: Frequent frustration or agitation.

name: Muscle tension
description: Tightness or aches in the muscles.

name: Sleep disturbances
description: Difficulty falling or staying asleep, or restless, unsatisfying sleep.

name: Palpitations
description: Pounding or racing heart.

name: Sweating
description: Excessive perspiration during episodes of anxiety.

name: Trembling or shaking
description: Observable physical trembling, often in hands.

name: Shortness of breath
description: Feeling smothered or unable to breathe.

name: Feelings of choking
description: A sensation of constriction in the throat.

name: Chest pain or discomfort
description: A common symptom during panic attacks.

name: Nausea or abdominal distress
description: Gastrointestinal discomfort, including queasiness or cramps.

name: Dizziness or lightheadedness
description: Feeling faint or unsteady.

name: Chills or hot flashes
description: Sudden changes in body temperature perception.

name: Numbness or tingling
description: Paresthesias often felt in extremities.

name: Derealization or depersonalization
description: Feeling detached from reality or oneself.

name: Fear of losing control or 'going crazy'
description: An overwhelming sense of helplessness or instability.

name: Fear of dying
description: A common fear during intense panic episodes.

name: Marked fear or anxiety
description: Disproportionate to the actual danger posed by specific objects or situations.

name: Avoidance behavior
description: Efforts to avoid feared situations, objects, or scenarios.

name: Immediate fear response
description: Anxiety occurs as soon as exposure to the feared object or situation happens.

name: Intense fear or anxiety in social situations
description: Triggered by performance situations where embarrassment or scrutiny is possible.

name: Avoidance of social situations
description: Avoidance of interactions or enduring them with intense anxiety.

name: Fear of humiliation
description: Worry about being judged, appearing anxious, or behaving inappropriately.

name: Marked fear of using public transportation
description: A key feature of agoraphobia related to transportation.

name: Marked fear of open spaces
description: Fear of locations such as parking lots, bridges, or fields.

name: Marked fear of enclosed spaces
description: Fear of being in theaters, elevators, or similar areas.

name: Marked fear of standing in line or being in a crowd
description: Fear associated with being surrounded by people or in close proximity.

name: Marked fear of being outside the home alone
description: Fear arises due to concerns about escape or access to help.

name: Excessive distress about separation from attachment figures
description: Observable distress when anticipating or experiencing separation.

name: Excessive worry about losing attachment figures
description: Fear of harm coming to loved ones.

name: Worry about events causing separation
description: Concerns about events like getting lost or being kidnapped.

name: Reluctance to leave home due to separation fears
description: Avoidance of leaving safe spaces to prevent separation.

name: Failure to speak in specific social situations
description: Despite being able to speak in other contexts (e.g., selective mutism).

name: Hypervigilance
description: Constant scanning of the environment for potential threats.

name: Impairment in daily life due to anxiety
description: Interference in relationships, work, or routines caused by fear or worry.

name: Recurrent, persistent thoughts, urges, or images
description: Intrusive and unwanted, causing marked anxiety or distress.

name: Attempts to ignore or suppress obsessions
description: Efforts to neutralize intrusive thoughts through other thoughts or actions.

name: Repetitive behaviors or mental acts
description: Performed in response to obsessions, such as handwashing, checking, or counting.

name: Behaviors aim to reduce distress
description: Actions performed to prevent or reduce distress, often unrealistic or excessive.

name: Preoccupation with physical appearance
description: Focus on perceived physical flaws, often unnoticeable to others.

name: Repetitive behaviors related to appearance
description: Behaviors such as mirror checking, skin picking, excessive grooming, or seeking reassurance.

name: Difficulty discarding possessions
description: Persistent difficulty discarding or parting with possessions, regardless of value.

name: Accumulation of clutter
description: Living areas become unusable due to excessive accumulation of items.

name: Recurrent hair-pulling
description: Pulling out one's hair, leading to noticeable hair loss.

name: Attempts to stop hair-pulling
description: Efforts to resist or reduce hair-pulling, often unsuccessful.

name: Recurrent skin-picking
description: Skin picking that results in lesions or noticeable damage.

name: Attempts to stop skin-picking
description: Efforts to resist or reduce skin-picking, often unsuccessful.

name: Obsessions without compulsions
description: Intrusive, distressing thoughts without associated ritualistic behaviors.

name: Body-focused repetitive behaviors
description: Behaviors such as nail-biting, lip-chewing, or other repetitive actions focused on the body.

name: Cultural-specific obsessions
description: Examples include obsession with perceived body odor or similar culturally specific concerns.

name: Recurrent, distressing thoughts or urges
description: Central to OCD, body dysmorphic disorder, and related conditions.

name: Repetitive behaviors or rituals
description: Actions performed to alleviate distress, such as compulsive checking or grooming.

name: Attempts to resist or control behaviors
description: Efforts to stop repetitive behaviors, often without success.

name: Functional impairment
description: Symptoms that interfere with work, relationships, or other important aspects of life.

name: Recurrent, distressing memories of trauma
description: Involuntary and distressing memories of the traumatic event, occurring repeatedly.

name: Distressing dreams related to trauma
description: Recurrent distressing dreams associated with the traumatic event.

name: Dissociative reactions (flashbacks)
description: Episodes where the individual feels as though the traumatic event is recurring.

name: Intense psychological distress to trauma cues
description: Severe emotional distress when exposed to reminders of the traumatic event.

name: Physiological reactions to trauma cues
description: Physical responses such as increased heart rate or sweating triggered by reminders of the trauma.

name: Avoidance of distressing thoughts or feelings
description: Efforts to avoid internal reminders such as memories or emotions related to the trauma.

name: Avoidance of external trauma reminders
description: Avoidance of places, people, or objects associated with the traumatic event.

name: Inability to recall trauma details
description: Difficulty remembering key aspects of the traumatic event.

name: Persistent negative beliefs
description: Ongoing negative perceptions about oneself, others, or the world (e.g., 'I am bad,' 'The world is dangerous').

name: Distorted blame related to trauma
description: Faulty thoughts leading to self-blame or blaming others for the traumatic event.

name: Persistent negative emotional states
description: Chronic feelings of fear, anger, shame, or similar emotions.

name: Diminished interest in activities
description: Reduced participation in or enjoyment of previously engaging activities.

name: Feelings of detachment from others
description: Experiencing estrangement or emotional disconnection from others.

name: Persistent inability to feel positive emotions
description: Difficulty experiencing happiness, satisfaction, or love.

name: Irritable or angry outbursts
description: Frequent episodes of anger or irritability with little provocation.

name: Reckless or self-destructive behavior
description: Engaging in dangerous or harmful actions without regard for consequences.

name: Hypervigilance
description: Heightened state of awareness and scanning for potential threats.

name: Exaggerated startle response
description: Strong and disproportionate reaction to sudden stimuli.

name: Difficulty concentrating
description: Trouble focusing on tasks or maintaining attention.

name: Sleep disturbances
description: Difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or experiencing restful sleep.

name: Marked distress disproportionate to stressor
description: Emotional responses that exceed what would be expected for the given stressor.

name: Persistent sadness or emotional discomfort
description: Feelings of sadness, hopelessness, or ongoing emotional unease.

name: Significant impairment in functioning
description: Difficulty maintaining social, occupational, or other responsibilities due to stress.

name: Minimal emotional responsiveness
description: Limited emotional reactions to others, often appearing unengaged.

name: Episodes of unexplained irritability or sadness
description: Unexpected emotional outbursts of sadness, fear, or irritability.

name: Failure to seek comfort when distressed
description: Lack of effort to seek or respond to caregivers when upset.

name: Overly familiar behavior with strangers
description: Engaging in behavior that is unusually open or familiar with unfamiliar adults.

name: Willingness to leave with unfamiliar adults
description: Showing no hesitation to leave a safe environment with a stranger.

name: Diminished checking back with caregivers
description: Reduced tendency to stay close or return to caregivers after venturing away.

name: Presence of distinct personality states
description: Observable presence of two or more distinct personality states or identities, often with changes in behavior, memory, or cognition.

name: Discontinuity in sense of self or agency
description: Disruption in a person’s sense of self or control over their actions.

name: Recurrent gaps in memory
description: Significant memory lapses for everyday events, personal information, or traumatic experiences, beyond typical forgetfulness.

name: Significant distress or dysfunction
description: Dissociative symptoms causing distress or impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of functioning.

name: Symptoms unrelated to cultural or religious practices
description: Dissociative experiences that cannot be better explained by cultural or religious norms, such as possession states.

name: Exclusion of substance use or medical condition
description: Dissociative symptoms not caused by substance use or medical conditions like seizures.

name: Inability to recall personal information
description: Difficulty remembering significant personal details, often related to trauma or stress.

name: Localized amnesia
description: Loss of memory for a specific period, such as events following a trauma.

name: Selective amnesia
description: Partial recall of only certain aspects of a traumatic event.

name: Generalized amnesia
description: Complete loss of memory for one’s entire life history.

name: Depersonalization
description: Experiences of detachment or being an outside observer of one’s thoughts, feelings, or actions.

name: Derealization
description: Experiences of detachment or unreality concerning surroundings, which may feel foggy or distorted.

name: Reality testing remains intact
description: Despite feelings of detachment, the individual understands their experiences are not real.

name: Disorientation
description: Difficulty identifying time, place, or personal identity.

name: Sudden re-experiencing of traumatic memories
description: Flashbacks or intrusive recollections of traumatic events.

name: Emotional numbing
description: Feeling detached or disconnected from one’s emotions.

name: Fugue states
description: Unexpected travel or wandering without memory of how or why the individual left.

name: Distressing physical symptoms
description: One or more somatic symptoms causing significant distress or functional impairment, including pain, fatigue, or other unexplained physical complaints.

name: Excessive thoughts about symptoms
description: Persistent thoughts about the seriousness of the symptoms, often disproportionate to their actual impact.

name: Health-related anxiety
description: High levels of anxiety specifically about health or somatic symptoms.

name: Excessive time and energy devoted to health concerns
description: Spending disproportionate time and energy managing or worrying about symptoms or health-related issues.

name: Chronicity of symptoms
description: Somatic symptoms persist for more than six months, even if specific complaints change over time.

name: Preoccupation with serious illness
description: Persistent worry about developing or having a serious health condition despite minimal or no somatic symptoms.

name: Excessive health-related behaviors
description: Frequent self-checks for signs of illness or avoidance of medical care out of fear of diagnosis.

name: Alterations in motor or sensory function
description: Symptoms such as paralysis, seizures, weakness, abnormal movement, or sensory loss without a recognized neurological cause.

name: Incompatibility with medical conditions
description: Symptoms inconsistent with known medical or neurological conditions.

name: Falsification of symptoms
description: Intentional fabrication or exaggeration of physical or psychological symptoms without clear external rewards.

name: Induction of symptoms in oneself or another
description: Inflicting illness or injury to oneself or another person, often a dependent.

name: Psychological factors exacerbating medical conditions
description: Psychological or behavioral factors such as stress or denial worsen a diagnosed medical condition or interfere with its treatment.

name: Somatic preoccupation
description: Excessive focus on physical sensations or conditions, often leading to distress or dysfunction.

name: Social or occupational impairment due to somatic concerns
description: Somatic symptoms cause significant disruption in daily functioning, relationships, or professional life.

name: Persistent eating of non-nutritive, non-food substances
description: Consumption of items such as dirt, chalk, paper, or soap, inappropriate for developmental level and not culturally supported or socially normative.

name: Repeated regurgitation of food
description: Food is re-chewed, re-swallowed, or spit out, causing significant distress or impairment and not attributable to a medical condition.

name: Avoidance of food intake
description: Significant restriction in eating leading to weight loss, nutritional deficiencies, dependence on nutritional supplements, or psychosocial impairment.

name: Lack of interest in eating or food
description: Avoidance based on sensory characteristics of food or fear of adverse consequences like choking or vomiting, not due to lack of food availability or cultural practices.

name: Restriction of energy intake
description: Maintaining a significantly low body weight relative to age, sex, developmental stage, and physical health.

name: Intense fear of gaining weight
description: Persistent fear of becoming fat, even while underweight.

name: Disturbance in body image
description: Distorted perception of body weight/shape or undue influence of body weight on self-evaluation, often with denial of the seriousness of low weight.

name: Recurrent episodes of binge eating
description: Eating a larger-than-normal amount of food within a discrete period, accompanied by feelings of lack of control.

name: Inappropriate compensatory behaviors
description: Behaviors such as self-induced vomiting, misuse of laxatives or diuretics, fasting, or excessive exercise to prevent weight gain.

name: Body image disturbance
description: Excessive concern with body shape and weight.

name: Eating rapidly or until uncomfortably full
description: Associated features of binge-eating episodes include rapid consumption or eating beyond satiety.

name: Eating large amounts when not physically hungry
description: Consuming food in the absence of physical hunger during binge episodes.

name: Eating alone due to embarrassment
description: Avoidance of eating in social settings because of shame about the quantity consumed.

name: Negative emotions after eating
description: Feelings of disgust, depression, or guilt following eating episodes.

name: Preoccupation with food, weight, or body shape
description: Persistent mental focus on food or body image across feeding and eating disorders.

name: Guilt or shame related to eating
description: Negative emotions tied to eating behaviors, often associated with episodes of overeating or restriction.

name: Nutritional deficiency
description: Observable effects such as anemia, fatigue, or malnourishment due to restrictive or excessive eating behaviors.

name: Medical complications
description: Physical issues such as heart irregularities, gastrointestinal problems, or electrolyte imbalances caused by disordered eating behaviors.

name: Difficulty initiating sleep
description: Trouble falling asleep despite adequate opportunity to sleep.

name: Difficulty maintaining sleep
description: Frequent awakenings or trouble returning to sleep.

name: Early-morning awakening
description: Waking up too early and being unable to return to sleep.

name: Daytime impairment or distress
description: Fatigue, mood disturbances, or reduced functioning during the day.

name: Excessive sleepiness despite adequate sleep
description: Feeling excessively sleepy despite a sleep period of at least 7 hours.

name: Recurrent daytime naps
description: Experiencing frequent daytime lapses into sleep.

name: Difficulty being fully awake after abrupt awakening
description: Feeling groggy or disoriented after waking up.

name: Prolonged main sleep episode
description: Sleeping more than 9 hours but still feeling unrefreshed.

name: Recurrent episodes of need to sleep during the day
description: Episodes of falling asleep or extreme sleepiness during the day.

name: Cataplexy
description: Sudden loss of muscle tone triggered by strong emotions.

name: Deficiency of hypocretin
description: Confirmed through cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) testing.

name: Disturbed nighttime sleep
description: Fragmented and interrupted sleep patterns at night.

name: Repeated episodes of airflow reduction
description: Snoring, gasping, or choking during sleep due to obstructive apnea.

name: Daytime fatigue from obstructive apnea
description: Feeling excessively tired during the day due to interrupted nighttime breathing.

name: Observed apneas
description: Breathing pauses during sleep noticed by a bed partner.

name: Repeated breathing pauses without effort
description: Episodes of breathing cessation during sleep with no respiratory effort.

name: Shallow breathing during sleep
description: Reduced airflow during sleep leading to symptoms such as fatigue or headaches.

name: Persistent sleep-wake pattern misalignment
description: Conflict between sleep schedule and environmental or social demands.

name: Daytime sleepiness due to circadian misalignment
description: Excessive sleepiness caused by inability to align sleep patterns with external schedules.

name: Sleepwalking
description: Rising from bed and walking around during sleep without awareness.

name: Sleep terrors
description: Sudden arousals during sleep with intense fear and autonomic activation.

name: Recurrent nightmares
description: Disturbing and vivid dreams that awaken the individual and cause distress.

name: Difficulty returning to sleep after nightmares
description: Trouble resuming sleep following an awakening caused by a nightmare.

name: Vocalizations during REM sleep
description: Talking, shouting, or making sounds during rapid eye movement (REM) sleep.

name: Dream enactment behaviors
description: Performing actions such as punching or kicking during REM sleep.

name: Unpleasant sensations in the legs
description: Feelings of discomfort or unease in the legs, particularly when at rest.

name: Relief from movement
description: Symptoms improve with walking or stretching.

name: Sleep disturbance due to leg discomfort
description: Difficulty sleeping due to discomfort or restlessness in the legs.

name: Significant delay in ejaculation
description: Noticeable delay in ejaculation during sexual activity despite adequate stimulation.

name: Infrequency or absence of ejaculation
description: Rare or absent ejaculation even with appropriate stimulation.

name: Distress related to delayed or absent ejaculation
description: Emotional or interpersonal difficulties stemming from ejaculation issues.

name: Difficulty obtaining an erection
description: Challenges in achieving an erection during sexual activity.

name: Difficulty maintaining an erection
description: Inability to sustain an erection until the completion of sexual activity.

name: Decrease in erectile rigidity
description: Reduced firmness of erection that interferes with penetration or satisfaction.

name: Significant delay or absence of orgasm
description: Delayed, infrequent, or absent orgasm during sexual activity.

name: Reduced intensity of orgasmic sensations
description: Diminished experience of pleasure during orgasm.

name: Distress related to orgasmic issues
description: Emotional or interpersonal difficulties caused by orgasmic challenges.

name: Absent or reduced sexual interest
description: Lack of sexual fantasies, thoughts, or desire for sexual activity.

name: Decreased initiation of sexual activity
description: Reduced willingness or responsiveness to a partner's sexual advances.

name: Reduced excitement during sexual activity
description: Decreased enjoyment or pleasure during sexual encounters.

name: Reduced genital or non-genital sensations
description: Diminished physical sensations during sexual activity.

name: Difficulty with vaginal penetration
description: Challenges or pain experienced during vaginal intercourse or penetration attempts.

name: Pelvic pain during penetration
description: Marked vulvovaginal or pelvic pain associated with intercourse or penetration.

name: Fear of pain related to vaginal penetration
description: Anxiety or distress associated with anticipated pain during penetration.

name: Tensing of pelvic muscles during penetration
description: Involuntary tightening of pelvic muscles during attempted vaginal penetration.

name: Absent sexual thoughts or fantasies
description: Persistent lack of sexual thoughts or fantasies.

name: Low desire for sexual activity
description: Deficient or absent interest in engaging in sexual activity.

name: Persistent or recurrent early ejaculation
description: Ejaculation occurring within approximately 1 minute of vaginal penetration or before desired.

name: Distress related to early ejaculation
description: Emotional or interpersonal difficulties stemming from premature ejaculation.

name: Substance-induced sexual dysfunction
description: Disturbance in sexual function related to substance intoxication, medication, or withdrawal.

name: Decreased libido due to substances or medications
description: Reduction in sexual desire linked to substance use or medication.

name: Difficulty achieving or maintaining an erection due to substances
description: Erectile challenges associated with substance intoxication, medication, or withdrawal.

name: Difficulty reaching orgasm due to substances
description: Challenges in achieving orgasm caused by substance use or medication.

name: Strong desire to be of the other gender
description: A persistent and strong desire to be of the other gender or an insistence that one is the other gender.

name: Preference for clothing associated with the other gender
description: A marked preference for wearing clothing typical of the other gender and rejection of clothing aligned with their assigned gender.

name: Preference for cross-gender roles in play
description: A strong preference for role-playing or pretending to be characters or people of the other gender.

name: Preference for toys or activities associated with the other gender
description: A marked preference for toys, games, or activities stereotypically associated with the other gender, accompanied by rejection of those linked to their assigned gender.

name: Preference for playmates of the other gender
description: A persistent preference for socializing and playing with children of the other gender.

name: Rejection of assigned gender traits
description: Avoidance or rejection of physical traits, roles, or behaviors associated with their assigned gender.

name: Strong dislike of one’s sexual anatomy
description: Significant distress or dislike toward physical characteristics associated with their assigned gender, such as genitals or secondary sexual traits.

name: Desire for physical traits of the experienced gender
description: A strong wish to have physical characteristics or sexual anatomy that align with their experienced gender.

name: Incongruence between experienced and assigned gender
description: Discomfort or incongruence between one’s experienced gender and physical characteristics, such as breasts or genitals, associated with the assigned gender.

name: Desire to remove primary or secondary sexual characteristics
description: A strong desire to be rid of primary or secondary sexual characteristics associated with the assigned gender.

name: Desire for physical traits of the experienced gender
description: A strong wish to possess physical sexual characteristics that align with their experienced gender.

name: Desire to be treated as the other gender
description: A persistent desire to be treated as the other gender or as a gender different from their assigned one.

name: Conviction of having typical feelings of the other gender
description: A firm conviction that one possesses the feelings or reactions typical of the other gender.

name: Distress or impairment due to gender incongruence
description: Significant distress or functional impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas due to gender incongruence.

name: Frequent temper outbursts
description: Recurring episodes of intense anger or frustration, often disproportionate to the situation.

name: Easily annoyed or touchy
description: Heightened sensitivity to perceived annoyances or slights, leading to irritability.

name: Angry and resentful
description: Persistent feelings of anger and a tendency to hold grudges.

name: Argues with authority figures
description: Frequent conflicts with parents, teachers, or other authority figures.

name: Refuses to comply with requests or rules
description: Persistent defiance of rules or directives from authority figures.

name: Deliberately annoys others
description: Purposeful actions intended to irritate or provoke others.

name: Blames others for mistakes or behavior
description: Refusal to accept responsibility for one’s actions, often shifting blame onto others.

name: Spiteful or vindictive
description: Exhibits spiteful or vengeful behavior at least twice in the past six months.

name: Bullies, threatens, or intimidates others
description: Aggressive behavior aimed at dominating or harming others.

name: Initiates physical fights
description: Repeated involvement in physical altercations.

name: Uses a weapon that can cause serious harm
description: Engages in violence with weapons like bats, knives, or firearms.

name: Physically cruel to people or animals
description: Intentional harm or cruelty directed at people or animals.

name: Steals while confronting a victim
description: Acts of theft involving direct confrontation, such as mugging or extortion.

name: Forced sexual activity
description: Coercing or forcing another person into sexual acts.

name: Deliberate fire-setting
description: Intentional setting of fires to cause harm or destruction.

name: Destruction of property
description: Willful acts of vandalism or destruction of others’ belongings.

name: Breaking and entering
description: Illegally entering buildings to commit theft or other offenses.

name: Deceitfulness to obtain goods or favors
description: Lying or manipulation to acquire resources or avoid obligations.

name: Stealing items without confrontation
description: Theft of objects without directly confronting a victim, such as shoplifting.

name: Stays out late despite parental prohibitions
description: Repeated disobedience of curfews, beginning before age 13.

name: Runs away from home
description: Leaving home overnight at least twice without parental consent.

name: Frequent truancy
description: Chronic absence from school without valid excuse, starting before age 13.

name: Verbal or physical aggression
description: Recurrent outbursts involving shouting, hitting, or property damage.

name: Outbursts grossly disproportionate to provocation
description: Aggressive responses that exceed the level of provocation or stress.

name: Deliberate fire-setting on multiple occasions
description: Repeated acts of intentionally setting fires for personal gratification.

name: Fascination with fire
description: Preoccupation with the uses, consequences, or imagery of fire.

name: Pleasure or relief from fire-setting
description: Feelings of satisfaction or calmness after setting or witnessing fires.

name: Failure to resist impulses to steal
description: Recurrent episodes of theft without need or monetary value.

name: Tension before theft
description: Heightened arousal or tension preceding acts of stealing.

name: Pleasure or relief after theft
description: Feelings of gratification or calmness following theft.

name: Memory impairment
description: Difficulty recalling recent events, forgetting personal information, or repeating questions or conversations.

name: Executive functioning impairment
description: Difficulty planning, organizing, multitasking, or making decisions. Includes poor judgment and struggles with problem-solving.

name: Attention impairment
description: Reduced ability to focus or sustain attention, easily distracted or overwhelmed by tasks.

name: Language deficits
description: Difficulty finding the right words, using nonspecific terms, or trouble understanding language.

name: Perceptual-motor impairments
description: Difficulty with spatial orientation, hand-eye coordination, or recognizing objects, faces, or environments.

name: Social cognition deficits
description: Reduced empathy, inappropriate behavior, or difficulty interpreting social cues.

name: Behavioral and emotional changes
description: Includes irritability, aggression, apathy, mood swings, and emotional instability.

name: Hallucinations and delusions
description: Perceiving things that are not present or having fixed, false beliefs such as paranoia or grandiosity.

name: Fluctuating attention (delirium)
description: Rapid shifts in alertness or awareness throughout the day.

name: Disorganized thinking (delirium)
description: Confusion or incoherent speech patterns.

name: Perceptual disturbances (delirium)
description: Hallucinations or misinterpreting stimuli.

name: Disturbed sleep-wake cycle (delirium)
description: Reversal of day-night sleep patterns or difficulty sleeping.

name: Severe cognitive decline (major neurocognitive disorder)
description: Profound loss in memory, language, or executive functioning.

name: Loss of independence (major neurocognitive disorder)
description: Inability to perform daily activities like cooking, dressing, or managing finances.

name: Mild cognitive decline
description: Subtle difficulties with memory, planning, or language, while maintaining daily activities with effort or strategies.

name: Personality changes (frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder)
description: Disinhibition, apathy, or compulsive behaviors characteristic of the behavioral variant.

name: Language loss (frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder)
description: Progressive loss of speech or comprehension.

name: Gradual cognitive decline (Alzheimer’s disease)
description: Progressive worsening of memory and cognitive function over time.

name: Impaired recognition (Alzheimer’s disease)
description: Difficulty recognizing familiar people or places.

name: Physical symptoms (traumatic brain injury)
description: Headaches, dizziness, or sensitivity to light/noise.

name: Cognitive impairments (traumatic brain injury)
description: Memory and attention deficits following injury.

name: Neurological symptoms (substance/medication-induced)
description: Tremors, ataxia, or slurred speech related to substance effects.

name: Motor symptoms (Parkinson’s disease)
description: Bradykinesia, rigidity, and tremors.

name: Cognitive symptoms (Parkinson’s disease)
description: Memory and executive function impairments.

name: Chorea (Huntington’s disease)
description: Involuntary, jerky movements characteristic of Huntington's disease.

name: Rapid cognitive decline (prion disease)
description: Marked deterioration in memory, coordination, and language.

name: Myoclonus (prion disease)
description: Involuntary muscle jerks associated with prion disease.

name: Persistent distrust and suspicion of others
description: Ongoing belief that others are exploiting, harming, or deceiving them without sufficient basis.

name: Belief that others are exploiting, harming, or deceiving them
description: Unfounded conviction that others have malicious intentions toward them.

name: Reluctance to confide in others
description: Hesitation or refusal to share personal information due to fear it will be used against them.

name: Misinterpretation of benign remarks as demeaning or threatening
description: Perceiving neutral or kind comments as critical or hostile.

name: Holding grudges for perceived slights or wrongs
description: Difficulty forgiving others and maintaining long-term resentment for minor offenses.

name: Unjustified suspicion of partner's fidelity
description: Baseless doubts or accusations about a romantic partner's loyalty.

name: Rapid defensiveness or hostility in response to perceived criticism
description: Quick and intense anger or aggression triggered by a belief of being attacked or criticized.

name: Lack of interest in forming or maintaining close relationships
description: Persistent disinterest in establishing or sustaining social bonds, including with family and peers.

name: Preference for solitary activities
description: Strong inclination toward spending time alone and engaging in activities that do not require social interaction.

name: Limited pleasure in most activities, including hobbies
description: Minimal enjoyment derived from various activities, even those typically found pleasurable.

name: Emotional coldness or detachment
description: Noticeable lack of emotional warmth, connection, or responsiveness in interactions with others.

name: Indifference to praise or criticism
description: Absence of concern or reaction to feedback from others, whether positive or negative.

name: Minimal or absent desire for sexual experiences
description: Little to no interest in engaging in sexual activities, even within close relationships.

name: Lack of close friends or confidants outside of family
description: Few or no meaningful relationships outside immediate family due to preference for solitude.

name: Eccentric behaviors, beliefs, or appearance
description: Unusual or peculiar mannerisms, beliefs, or style of dress that deviate significantly from societal norms.

name: Odd speech patterns or thinking
description: Speech or thought patterns that are vague, metaphorical, overly elaborate, or difficult to follow.

name: Suspiciousness or paranoid ideation
description: A persistent sense of mistrust or paranoia about the motives or intentions of others.

name: Social anxiety due to paranoid fears, not judgment of others
description: Avoidance or discomfort in social interactions driven by fear of others’ intentions rather than fear of being judged.

name: Inappropriate or constricted emotional expression
description: Emotional reactions that are either excessively limited or inappropriate for the situation.

name: Unusual perceptual experiences
description: Experiences such as sensing the presence of others when no one is present or other distortions in perception.

name: Lack of close friends or confidants outside of family
description: Few or no meaningful personal relationships beyond immediate family, often due to social discomfort or eccentric behavior.

name: Repeated disregard for the rights of others
description: A consistent pattern of violating the rights of others, including unlawful or unethical behaviors.

name: Deceitfulness
description: Engaging in lying, use of aliases, or conning others for personal gain or pleasure.

name: Impulsivity or failure to plan ahead
description: Acting without forethought or failing to consider consequences of actions.

name: Irritability and aggressiveness
description: Frequent displays of anger or aggression, often leading to physical altercations.

name: Reckless disregard for the safety of self or others
description: Engaging in dangerous behaviors with little or no concern for safety.

name: Consistent irresponsibility
description: A pattern of failing to meet obligations such as work, finances, or social duties.

name: Lack of remorse after harming others
description: An absence of guilt or regret for causing harm to others.

name: Intense fear of abandonment
description: A pervasive fear of being rejected or left alone, often leading to frantic efforts to avoid it.

name: Unstable relationships
description: Patterns of alternating between idealization and devaluation in interpersonal relationships.

name: Identity disturbance
description: An unstable or distorted self-image or sense of self.

name: Impulsivity in self-damaging behaviors
description: Engaging in risky activities such as substance abuse, reckless spending, or unsafe sexual practices.

name: Recurrent suicidal behaviors or self-harm
description: Frequent expressions of suicidal ideation, gestures, or attempts, along with self-injurious behaviors.

name: Intense mood instability
description: Rapid and unpredictable changes in emotional states.

name: Chronic feelings of emptiness
description: A pervasive sense of inner void or lack of fulfillment.

name: Inappropriate or intense anger
description: Episodes of intense or poorly controlled anger, often disproportionate to the situation.

name: Transient paranoia or dissociation under stress
description: Short episodes of paranoid thinking or feeling detached from reality, triggered by stress.

name: Discomfort when not the center of attention
description: A strong need to be the focus of attention in social situations, leading to discomfort if not achieved.

name: Inappropriate sexually seductive or provocative behavior
description: Behaviors aimed at gaining attention or approval through sexual means, inappropriate to the situation.

name: Rapidly shifting and shallow emotional expressions
description: Emotions that change quickly and lack depth or authenticity.

name: Use of physical appearance to draw attention
description: Excessive focus on appearance to gain attention or approval.

name: Excessively impressionistic and vague speech
description: Speech that is overly dramatic but lacks detail or clarity.

name: Overly dramatic, theatrical, or exaggerated emotions
description: Expressing emotions in an exaggerated manner to gain attention.

name: Suggestibility
description: Being easily influenced by others or circumstances.

name: Perception of relationships as more intimate than they are
description: Viewing casual or superficial relationships as deeper or more meaningful than they actually are.

name: Grandiose sense of self-importance
description: Exaggerated self-view, often involving overstatement of achievements or abilities.

name: Preoccupation with fantasies of success, power, or beauty
description: Persistent daydreaming about unattainable ideals such as unlimited power or beauty.

name: Belief in being 'special' and only understood by high-status individuals
description: Viewing oneself as unique and associating only with those perceived as equally special.

name: Need for excessive admiration
description: A craving for constant attention and approval from others.

name: Sense of entitlement
description: Unreasonable expectations of favorable treatment or compliance with one's desires.

name: Exploitativeness in relationships
description: Using others for personal gain without regard for their feelings or needs.

name: Lack of empathy for others
description: Inability or unwillingness to recognize or understand the feelings of others.

name: Envy of others or belief others are envious
description: Persistent feelings of jealousy or the belief that others are jealous of them.

name: Arrogant or haughty behaviors or attitudes
description: Displaying an overt sense of superiority or dismissiveness toward others.

name: Avoidance of social interactions due to fear of criticism or rejection
description: Persistent avoidance of social situations stemming from a fear of being negatively judged or rejected by others.

name: Reluctance to engage in new activities due to fear of embarrassment
description: Hesitation to try new experiences or activities because of a fear of being humiliated.

name: Preoccupation with being criticized or rejected in social settings
description: Excessive worry about negative evaluation or rejection in interpersonal interactions.

name: Inhibition in interpersonal situations due to feelings of inadequacy
description: Limited or restrained behavior in social situations because of a sense of inferiority.

name: View of self as socially inept or inferior
description: Belief that one lacks social skills or is fundamentally less capable than others.

name: Reluctance to take personal risks or try new things
description: Avoidance of risks or unfamiliar situations due to fear of failure or embarrassment.

name: Extreme sensitivity to negative evaluation
description: Heightened awareness and distress about being judged or criticized by others.

name: Difficulty making decisions without excessive advice or reassurance
description: Inability to make choices independently and seeking constant guidance or confirmation from others.

name: Fear of disagreeing with others due to fear of losing support
description: Reluctance to express differing opinions because of the worry that it may lead to loss of approval or assistance.

name: Difficulty initiating projects or tasks independently
description: Reliance on others for direction and a lack of self-confidence to start tasks on one’s own.

name: Extreme efforts to obtain nurturing and support
description: Engaging in excessive behaviors to ensure care and approval from others, even at the cost of personal boundaries.

name: Feelings of discomfort or helplessness when alone
description: A strong sense of unease or inability to function independently without companionship.

name: Urgent need to establish a new relationship after one ends
description: Compulsive pursuit of a new relationship to replace a lost source of support or care.

name: Unrealistic fears of being left to care for oneself
description: An intense and disproportionate fear of abandonment and being unable to cope alone.

name: Preoccupation with details, rules, or schedules to the detriment of productivity
description: Fixation on organizational aspects that impairs efficiency and goal achievement.

name: Perfectionism that interferes with task completion
description: Unrealistically high standards that prevent timely completion of tasks.

name: Excessive devotion to work or productivity at the expense of leisure
description: Neglect of social or recreational activities due to overcommitment to work or responsibilities.

name: Rigidity and stubbornness in behavior or attitudes
description: Inflexible adherence to personal routines or beliefs, resisting changes or alternative ideas.

name: Reluctance to delegate tasks unless done their way
description: Hesitation to assign tasks to others unless they follow exact instructions.

name: Hoarding items of no sentimental or monetary value
description: Retention of objects without practical use, leading to clutter and difficulty discarding them.

name: Misery over spending, viewing money as something to be hoarded
description: Excessive frugality and reluctance to spend money, even when it is reasonable or necessary.

name: Compulsive engagement in specific activities
description: Repetitive or ritualistic behaviors related to atypical sexual interests.

name: Difficulty controlling impulses
description: Failure to resist urges or behaviors despite negative consequences.

name: Violation of social or legal norms
description: Actions breaching social, moral, or legal boundaries, such as voyeurism or exhibitionism.

name: Distress or impairment
description: Persistent preoccupation with atypical interests leading to emotional or functional problems.

name: Risky or harmful behaviors
description: Engagement in activities that endanger oneself or others, such as exposing oneself or coercing others.

name: Exposure of genitals to unsuspecting individuals
description: Revealing one's genitals to people without their consent for shock or attention, characteristic ofExhibitionistic Disorder.

name: Engaging in inappropriate or public sexual acts
description: Performing sexual acts in public settings to shock or gain attention, associated with Exhibitionistic Disorder.

name: Intense focus on non-living objects or specific body parts
description: Sexual arousal tied to fetishized items or body parts, such as shoes or feet, seen in Fetishistic Disorder.

name: Difficulty engaging in typical sexual activities without fetishized items
description: Dependence on specific objects or body parts for sexual arousal, part of Fetishistic Disorder.

name: Touching or rubbing against non-consenting individuals
description: Seeking sexual arousal by physical contact with others without consent, often in crowded spaces, associated withFrotteuristic Disorder.

name: Seeking physical proximity to unsuspecting individuals for sexual arousal
description: Positioning oneself close to others to achieve sexual stimulation, linked to Frotteuristic Disorder.

name: Persistent sexual focus on prepubescent children
description: Sexual attraction or fantasies involving children, defining Pedophilic Disorder.

name: Engaging in activities or seeking opportunities to be alone with children
description: Actions driven by a sexual focus on children, characteristic of Pedophilic Disorder.

name: Seeking situations involving humiliation, pain, or suffering for sexual arousal
description: Deriving sexual gratification from being subjected to pain or humiliation, part of Sexual Masochism Disorder.

name: Physical marks or injuries indicative of self-inflicted harm
description: Visible signs of harm resulting from masochistic activities, linked to Sexual Masochism Disorder.

name: Infliction of pain, humiliation, or suffering on others for sexual gratification
description: Gaining sexual pleasure from causing others pain or suffering, associated with Sexual Sadism Disorder.

name: Coercing or manipulating others into participating in harmful activities
description: Forcing others into painful or humiliating situations for sexual pleasure, part of Sexual Sadism Disorder.

name: Preoccupation with cross-dressing for sexual arousal
description: Using clothing associated with another gender to achieve sexual stimulation, characteristic of TransvesticDisorder.

name: Distress or compulsive behaviors related to cross-dressing
description: Experiencing emotional discomfort or compulsions tied to cross-dressing, linked to Transvestic Disorder.

name: Secretly watching others engaged in private activities
description: Observing people in private acts, such as undressing or sexual activities, without their consent, associatedwith Voyeuristic Disorder.

name: Using tools or strategies to facilitate surveillance
description: Employing items like binoculars or cameras to observe others secretly, linked to Voyeuristic Disorder.

name: Unusual or Atypical Behaviors
description: Actions or behaviors that deviate significantly from cultural or social norms, such as bizarre actions orunpredictable reactions to routine events.

name: Cognitive Impairments
description: Observable confusion or disorganized thinking, as well as memory difficulties not attributable to neurocognitivedisorders.

name: Affective Instability
description: Intense, rapid emotional fluctuations and inappropriate emotional responses, such as laughing during a sad event

name: Behavioral Changes
description: Sudden or prolonged shifts in daily routines, social interactions, work performance, or personal care behaviors.

name: Psychomotor Abnormalities
description: Slowed movements or agitation without medical explanation, including behaviors such as fidgeting, restlessness,or lethargy.

name: Unexplained Distress or Functional Impairment
description: Difficulties in social, academic, or occupational functioning, with emotional or behavioral symptoms that do notmeet criteria for another disorder.

name: Tardive Dyskinesia
description: The individual reports experiencing involuntary, repetitive movements of the face, tongue, lips, or limbs, whichmay include sensations of uncontrollable lip-smacking, grimacing, or rapid blinking.

name: Parkinsonism
description: The individual describes symptoms resembling Parkinson’s disease, such as tremors at rest, feelings of musclerigidity or stiffness, slowed movements (bradykinesia), and difficulty maintaining balance (postural instability), often linkedto medication use.

name: Akathisia
description: The individual feels a strong inner restlessness and an urge to move, leading to behaviors such as pacing,shifting weight from one foot to the other, or an inability to remain still.

name: Acute Dystonia
description: The individual experiences sudden, painful muscle contractions leading to twisting or abnormal postures, such asneck twisting (torticollis), upward eye movement (oculogyric crisis), or jaw clenching.

name: Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome
description: A potentially life-threatening reaction involving severe muscle rigidity, rapid heart rate, fluctuating bloodpressure, extreme heat sensations (hyperthermia), and altered mental states such as confusion or agitation, often occurringafter starting or increasing antipsychotic medication.

name: Medication-Induced Postural Tremor
description: The individual notices rhythmic, involuntary shaking when maintaining a posture, such as tremors in the hands,head, or other body parts, especially while still.

name: Tardive Dystonia
description: The individual experiences persistent muscle contractions that cause twisting movements, particularly affectingthe neck, trunk, or limbs, often after prolonged medication use.

name: Tardive Akathisia
description: A feeling of persistent restlessness or an inability to stay still, with behaviors such as repetitive pacing orleg movements, occurring after long-term use of certain medications.

name: Other Dyskinesias
description: The individual reports uncontrolled, involuntary movements, such as jerking, writhing, or slow and purposelessmotions, that affect various muscle groups.
